author: Orion

posts.content:
The Half-Orc Verdant Champion

This is an interesting idea I have been pursuing:

- Useful melee attack on a druid
- DC druid spellcasting including getting dragon shape
- Getting some monk levels for wis AC, Monk UBAB, more powerful shifted forms and druid melee

Druids have this interesting dilemma where they have amazing AoE disables but damage output is not the highest unless they polymorph.
If they polymorph then they no longer are able to cast spells, and often I find myself wishing I could cast spells after polymorphing.

Here I combined an AB 37 BAB 27 melee attack with Monk UBAB (6-8 APR) and Str 22 (capped at 34 - +12 str damage), Wisdom 30 (42 capped +16 to DCs and Wis AC) with dragon shape at level 35, ESF: Conjuration, great AC and fort/will saves around 30 from CoT. There is also a useful ranged AB 38 attack for +12 damage dart throwing if this is desired. 

There can be extra AB from being outdoors (+2), flanking with your summons/companion (+2), making your opponent flatfooted (losing Dex, Dodge and Tumble AC -> this will improve at higher levels, if successful), plus a Druid's Str and Wis tends to be capped fairly easily. Monk UBAB is also more forgiving, with a 3 AB reduction with subsequent attacks compared with the standard 5 AB reduction.

Shifted forms are powerful but not mandatory for combat, the only more powerful form than melee form hopefully being Dragon Shape, which is 3x/day and cannot fit through standard doors, also is not knockdown immune without discipline or Rogue/UMD (Thieves Hood) in the build, so in a rest-restricted environment, it saves on usage of this ability. Interestingly the BAB 27 with Epic Prowess will mean the Dragon Shape will have a higher AB than most Druid's DS forms, usually having a BAB of 25-26.

SoV DC = Reflex 41 or stun
Stonehold DC = Will 38 or paralysis
Grease DC = Reflex 33 or knockdown

I chose half-orc here because I wanted as much AB as I could while preserving a high Wis score, human gets a lot more skill points, no exp penalties (half-orc has 20% exp penalties from level 22 onwards) and a bonus pre-epic feat at the cost of 2 str and 1 AB and darkvision. I think the build can manage without the skill points, it has druid spell casting, a useful melee and ranged attack, great saves, evasion, true seeing. Maybe human is stronger but for now I am keen to let the half-orc have his/her day for once. Discipline is missed though, and a human could get that skill. I put a value point in set trap because druids get "One with the Land" which adds +4 to set trap. Search is in the build for hidden doors. Playtested to level 5 so far.

The class split Druid 28 / CoT 10 / Monk 2 is a famous one, used by Maximillan Kane's Champion of the Wilderness written in 2010. There are enough differences with his build to make this one unique and different.

In the archives, christian.schnabel's Nature's Spellsword (Druid 24 / Monk 6 / CoT 10) is a strength focused druid spellsword, gets Str 26, mundane AB 38, 460hp and a lot of skill points, Wis 22 with no dragon shape (ie 4 more Str and 1 more AB at the cost of spell casting), so 37 AB isn't too bad considering DC casting is in the build and an 8 higher wisdom score plus the wis AC associated with it.
